items.q: ____________________ (Since / As a result of) the weather was bad, we decided to cancel our picnic.
Charlie loves animals. ____________________ (Because of / For this reason), he has taken in many stray cats and dogs.
Sarah's car broke down and needed a very expensive repair job. ____________________ (Due to / Consequently), she couldn't afford to go skiing during the winter break.
The roads were all closed (as a result of / as a result) ____________________ the flooding that accompanied the storm.
Bill was sorry to learn that he didn't get the job he had applied for ____________________ (on account of / thus) his lack of experience.
Barry graduated at the top of his college class. ____________________ (Because / As a result), he was hired by an outstanding law firm within a week of graduation.
____________________ (Because of / Due) his perfect attendance, Brett was awarded a special certificate at the end of the semester.
The convention was cancelled ____________________ (thus / due to) a lack of ticket sales.
____________________ (Because of / Because) she had a lot of studying to do, Ashley decided not to go to the beach with her friends.
Frank was consistently absent to class. ____________________ (As a result of / Thus), his scholarship was invalidated.

What effect has the increased production of bottled water had on the environment? a. There are many more items being thrown away in landfills. b. People can buy bottled water from many companies. c. Fuel sources are being depleted faster because a lot of energy is needed to make these items.

Why has the music industry lost revenue in recent years? a. Illegal music downloads have increased, taking money away from the companies who create the music. b. People can buy one song at a time, which means that record companies are not selling as many copies of CDs. c. Recording artists are not making good songs anymore.

What are the effects of stress on a person's overall health? a. All people experience some form of stress in the workplace. b. Stress can lead to headaches, muscle aches, and can result in sleep disorders. c. Stress results in more frequent visits to a doctor and more expensive medical bills.

Why have fast food restaurants become so popular over the past few decades? a. Fast food is much less expensive than most restaurants. b. Many of these restaurants now have healthy options on the menu. c. Many people like the speed and convenience of fast food restaurants.

How has the Internet impacted everyday life? a. You often have to pay a monthly fee to access the Internet from your home. b. People can pay bills, shop, and get news online, which makes it a very convenient place to take care of all of your errands. c. People are increasingly turning to social networking sites to speak with friends, and are not practicing as much face-to-face communication.
a blunder a. a mistake b. a person c. a tool
an ideology a. intelligence b. beliefs c. a form of government
availability a. presence b. thought c. feelings
interactive a. alone b. not alone c. difficult
momentous a. boring b. important c. tall
the advent a. termination b. future c. beginning
the forefront a. new ideas b. old ideas c. popular ideas
to propel a. to move forward b. to move slowly c. to stay in one place
to rejoice a. sad feelings b. happy feelings c. angry feelings
via a. far away b. close c. using
one negative effect of stress _____ people
an _____ benefit
to _____ a role
to resort _____ an alternative plan
to be _____ the forefront
a _____ of normal life
to _____ access to something
to have a difficult _____
to get _____ a bad situation
convenient _____ everyone

never at any time
blue in color
an unexpected surprise
the pair of twins

hot steam

twelve noon

I. Introduction (Paragraph 1) A. Hook: B. Thesis statement: E-mail has changed the way people communicate in two key ways. E-mail allows people to instantly communicate with others who live far away. You can get responses from many people from just one e-mail. 3. Consequently, e-mail can improve the communication between a group of people who live in different places. B.
